meanings.definition: A type of crossbow used in medieval times.
meanings.sent1: The arbalest was a powerful weapon in ancient battles.
meanings.sent2: The knight aimed the arbalest at the enemy castle.
meanings.sent3: The arbalest was so heavy, it made the knight stumble comically.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an arbalest, always ready to strike.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the arbalest releasing its bolt echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: To shoot or aim with an arbalest.
meanings.sent1: He carefully arbalested the target, hitting the bullseye.
meanings.sent2: The archer learned how to arbalest accurately after much practice.
meanings.sent3: She arbalested with such precision that it seemed like magic.
meanings.sent4: His words arbalested straight to her heart, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent5: The team arbalested their way to victory, surprising everyone with their skill.
